title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: Specify <Server port='1'> in server.xml. There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that. I suppose that jsvc may show the same behavior, but I have not tried.
OB: When Tomcat is installed as a service on Windows and the <Server port='1'> configuration is used in the server.xml file, an error message is printed during shutdown.
EB: The error message should not be printed when shutting down Tomcat with <Server port='1'> configuration.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 
2. Start the service. 
3. Stop the service. 
4. Shut down the server through an OS signal, such as calling Catalina.stop().
